title: How to Get Good at Command 'n Conquer Renegade

steps.headline: Download and install GameSpy Arcade.
steps.description: It's the easiest way to access the servers that host Renegade.

steps.headline: Have Gamespy scan for games.
steps.description: It should detect Renegade. Then, click on the 'C&C Renegade' button to find a server and start playing.

steps.headline: When you start playing Renegade, do so for 30-60 minutes at a time.
Use all the different units and practice with them (both vehicle and infantry).
steps.description: In Renegade you earn money that you can use to purchase units. Usually, the more a unit costs, the better it is.

steps.headline: Aim for the head with infantry and for the turret in most vehicles.
steps.description: Shooting these areas does more damage. You do over ten times more damage hitting an infantry man's head than his body.

steps.headline: Improve your shot with the pistol.
steps.description: This is a basic weapon that every infantry character has. Once you run out of ammunition with your main weapon, the pistol becomes necessary. 4 or 5 shots to the head will kill any infantry unit, and you have infinite ammo with your pistol. You can get out of some pretty tight spots if you are proficient with the pistol.

steps.headline: Dodge fire by moving side to side and jumping up and down, especially in one-on-one fire fights.
steps.description: You can dodge in tanks by moving backwards and forwards quickly while shooting at the enemy. The slower your tank, the harder it is to dodge,but the more armor the unit has.

steps.headline: When destroying buildings, place your C4's on the Master Control Terminals.
steps.description: Detonate your "Remote C4s" at the same time your "Timed C4s" explode. This ensures that the enemy won't be able to repair the building(s), and thus save them, before it gets destroyed.

steps.headline: Force the other team to defend.
steps.description: Remember the old "offense is the best defense" policy? In this case, it really is. If you force the other team into a defensive position they can't attack you without risking losing one or more of their buildings.

steps.headline: If you find that you like the game, and get pretty good at it, keep playing and practicing.
steps.description: While practicing won't make you perfect, you can get very close, and it's fun to watch the other players' comments in the chat box at the top of the screen after you've nearly destroyed them.

text: Install Renegade.  Download and install GameSpy Arcade. It's the easiest way to access the servers that host Renegade. Have Gamespy scan for games. It should detect Renegade. Aim for the head with infantry and for the turret in most vehicles. Shooting these areas does more damage. You do over ten times more damage hitting an infantry man's head than his body. Improve your shot with the pistol. This is a basic weapon that every infantry character has. Once you run out of ammunition with your main weapon, the pistol becomes necessary. 4 or 5 shots to the head will kill any infantry unit, and you have infinite ammo with your pistol. You can get out of some pretty tight spots if you are proficient with the pistol. Dodge fire by moving side to side and jumping up and down, especially in one-on-one fire fights. You can dodge in tanks by moving backwards and forwards quickly while shooting at the enemy. The slower your tank, the harder it is to dodge,but the more armor the unit has. When destroying buildings, place your C4's on the Master Control Terminals. Detonate your "Remote C4s" at the same time your "Timed C4s" explode. This ensures that the enemy won't be able to repair the building(s), and thus save them, before it gets destroyed. Force the other team to defend. Remember the old "offense is the best defense" policy? In this case, it really is. If you force the other team into a defensive position they can't attack you without risking losing one or more of their buildings. If you find that you like the game, and get pretty good at it, keep playing and practicing.
